item.title: japan powerbroker ozawa ready to challenge pm: report
item.description: ruling party powerbroker ichiro ozawa is considering backing a no-confidence motion against prime minister naoto kan, raising the possibility that japan will have another change at the top as it grapples with a nuclear crisis and deep economic problems.

item.title: finals | mavericks 95, heat 93: nowitzki pulls dallas out of hole to new life
item.description: dirk nowitzki made a layup with three seconds to play as dallas rallied from a 15-point deficit in the final quarter.

item.title: more evidence folic acid prevents birth defects
item.description: a new study finds that south carolina's rate of spina bifida and similar birth defects fell substantially after more women began taking folic acid -- adding to evidence of the b vitamin's benefits during pregnancy.

item.title: analysis: explaining sullinger's decision to stay
item.description: 'you can etch it in stone,' satch sullinger said about his son jared's return to ohio state next year even though he is a projected first-round n.b.a. draft pick.

item.title: missouri makes progress in identifying missing
item.description: the number of people missing after a tornado in joplin has been reduced to 232 from about 1,500, officials said.

item.title: russia's ruling party stumbles in some regional elections
item.description: while russia's ruling party won easily in regional elections this weekend, it drew less than half of the popular vote in a sign that the opposition's hand is strengthening.

item.title: ailing dollar boosts demand for commodities, credit
item.description: the dollar floundered at three-year lows against a basket of currencies on friday, keeping precious metals near record highs, although the risk of dealers covering bets against the beleaguered u.s. currency in thin trading looms, especially given holidays in some centers including japan.

item.title: revisiting notes from a roommate search begun on 9/10/01
item.description: brian sloan's 'wtc view' is about a young gay man and his search for a roommate after 9/11.

item.title: dollar keeps falling after fed, stocks buoyant
item.description: the dollar slid to three-year lows on thursday, helping u.s. crude oil up to a 2-1/2 year high, and stocks rose worldwide as investors bet ultra-loose u.s. policy will continue to drive money into riskier assets.

item.title: top down: the 3 biggest tax breaks ' and what they cost us
item.description: each has serious flaws, and if washington is finally going to get serious about the country's long-term fiscal problems, there is no better place to start.

item.title: under the ice, sounds of spring
item.description: below the barren arctic icescape, the ocean is alive with the sounds of whales and seals.

item.title: u.s. dollar frail, tokyo stocks slip, gold shines
item.description: the dollar hovered around three-year lows on friday and looked set to come under further pressure next week, while a stronger yen weighed on tokyo stocks in holiday-thinned good friday trade.

item.title: former maryland governor, baltimore mayor dies
item.description: william donald schaefer died monday at his home at the charlestown retirement community outside baltimore.

item.title: upbeat company earnings boost global stocks, commodities
item.description: upbeat earnings from companies including chip maker intel lifted stocks and boosted appetite for riskier assets on wednesday, driving commodities higher and the australian dollar to a 29-year high versus the dollar.

item.title: dollar hits 3-yr low; gold, asian stocks march on
item.description: the u.s. dollar slid to a 3-year low against a basket of major currencies and asian stocks jumped to a 3-year high on thursday, as investors scrambled to get in front of upward momentum in higher-yielding assets, particularly in emerging markets.

item.title: silver slide ripples out, fed in focus
item.description: silver tumbled before finding a footing on tuesday, dragging prices of gold and oil with it and subduing european shares, although investors were wary of taking strong positions ahead of a u.s. federal reserve policy meeting.

item.title: dollar near 3-year lows on fed view, stocks rise
item.description: the u.s. dollar plumbed a near 3-year low against other major currencies on wednesday before a federal reserve decision, which is expected to reinforce an ultra-easy policy stance and drive more capital to buoyant emerging asian stock markets.

item.title: aussie dollar hits 29-year peak; seoul shares shine
item.description: the australian dollar hit a fresh 29-year high and south korea's benchmark share index touched another record intraday high on monday, suggesting investors were still eager to embrace risk and higher-yielding assets.

item.title: one protester killed as security forces open fire in yemen
item.description: fifteen people were wounded and one was killed, doctors at a field hospital said, in the first outbreak of violence in sana since snipers killed 52 protesters more than three weeks ago.

item.title: number of displaced people hits global high
item.description: the number of internally displaced people worldwide reached 27.5 million in 2010, the highest number since the mid-1990s even though the situation in africa improved, a refugee agency said on wednesday.

item.description: the euro fell on monday and stocks were weaker as the rise of a euro-skeptic party in finland added another potential hurdle to solving the euro zone's debt problems.

item.description: joseph f. skowron, who specialized in health care funds, also faces charges for conspiring to hide his role in an illicit trading scheme, prosecutors said.

item.title: asian stocks fall after u.s. credit outlook cut
item.description: asian stocks fell on tuesday after rating agency standard & poor's lowered its u.s. credit outlook to negative, prompting a global flight to other assets.

item.description: a small trial has shown that a type of gene therapy for patients with advanced parkinson's disease can reduce symptoms of the devastating brain condition.

item.description: two workers shot to death on monday while waiting to cross the border from mexico into the united states were american citizens, the u.s. state department said.

item.description: despite much evidence linking tanning (and burning) with skin cancer 80% of white teenage girls and young women said they'd tanned outdoors.

item.description: forces loyal to muammar gaddafi stepped up their onslaught on rebel areas of libya's western mountains late on monday, rebels said, and refugees said towns in the isolated region were on the brink of starvation.

item.description: sales of new single-family homes in february were down more than 80 percent from the 2005 peak, signaling a shift in behavior from buyers seeking smaller places.

item.title: china sends man to labor camp over "jasmine" rally
item.description: a 21-year-old chinese man who attended a proposed pro-democracy "jasmine revolution" protest in beijing was sentenced to labor re-education, in the first confirmed punishment for the middle east-inspired gatherings that were squashed by wary authorities.

item.description: nato must broaden the range of targets it is bombing in libya or risk failing to remove muammar gaddafi from power, britain's most senior military officer was quoted as saying.

item.description: the nfl players association will host at least 20 incoming nfl rookies at a three-day long draft celebration later this month.

item.title: china sovereign wealth fund eyeing europe despite risks

item.title: knicks keep fans in dark about front-office plans

item.title: ahmadinejad remains caretaker oil minister: aide

item.title: rajaratnam jury grapples with mound of documents
